intro: Telanthera brasiliensis f. grisea, commonly known as the gray-flowered telanthera, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish leaves and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. The varietal form 'grisea' is distinguished by its distinctive grayish foliage and reduced floral coloration compared to the typical form.
